newsitem.title: UK: Daily Mail to refinance exchangeable bond.
newsitem.headline: Daily Mail to refinance exchangeable bond.

text.p: Daily Mail and General Trust Plc has offered to buy back the 47.9 million stg outstanding on its 5.75 percent bond due 2003 which is exchangeable into shares in Reuters Holdings Plc, arranger J.P. Morgan Securities said on Monday.
Daily Mail will issue a new bond due 2004 which will be exchangeable into Reuters shares.

The repurchase price of the 2003 bonds will be equal to Reuters' mid-price, at a time to be decided, multiplied by the number of shares per bond plus an as yet unspecified premium indicated at 6-8 percent, J.P. Morgan said.
Daily Mail will also pay any accrued interest.
The offer closes on Friday, May 23.
Daily Mail will issue a new exchangeable bond due 2004 whose indicative terms will be announced before the buy-back offer closes.
J.P. Morgan said Daily Mail owned 24 million Reuters shares, 10 million of which had been set aside for the 2003 exchangeable bond.
That bond was issued in September 1993 at an exchange price of 4.795 stg per share.
At 0810 GMT Reuters was quoted at 677 pence stg, up 5p on the day.
The exchange price on the new 2004 bond will be at a premium to Reuters market price, J.P. Morgan said.
